channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How the Supreme Court Secretly Made Itself Even More Secretive
item.description: Amid calls to increase transparency and revelations about the court’s inner workings, the chief justice imposed nondisclosure agreements on clerks and...

item.title: After being hit by a car, she was saved by a lavender bunny
item.description: Eight years ago, Joann Moschella was injured after her bicycle was hit by a car. That's when her unsung hero appeared, dressed in a furry lavender bun...

item.title: This global health leader praises Trump's aid plan -- and gears up to beat malaria

item.title: With an ACA fix uncertain in the Senate, Republicans replay old health care fights
item.description: Things are looking bleak for a fix in Congress for ACA premiums that doubled, on average, this month. And Republicans are making arguments against the...

item.title: Laura Fernández Wins Costa Rican Presidency
item.description: Laura Fernández’s victory was driven by a crisis in which Costa Rica’s reputation for peace has been tarred by record-breaking violence.

item.title: A 1987 Proposal Could Help Hold ICE to Account for Constitutional Violations
item.description: A proposal in a 1987 law review article could address a gap that makes it all but impossible to sue federal officials for violating the Constitution.

item.title: Rafah Crossing in Gaza Reopens, Another Step for Fragile Cease-Fire
item.description: Israel and Egypt had disagreed for months about how to resume operations at the Rafah border crossing, which has been largely closed since May 2024.

item.title: The House races to end shutdown. And, Trump wants to close Kennedy Center for 2 years
item.description: Lawmakers are racing to end a partial government shutdown after Congress missed its funding deadline on Friday. And, Trump wants to close the Kennedy ...

item.title: Hemp and marijuana are the same species. So why all the different laws?
item.description: Farmers in the U.S. have grown cannabis since the 1600s — but policymakers are still figuring out how to regulate two famous types of Cannabis sativa ...

item.title: Squeezed Between Trump and China, India Looks for Faraway Friendships
item.description: India is overcoming its aversion to free-trade deals to cozy up with Canada and other middle powers.

item.title: Colombia’s President, an Outspoken Trump Critic, Heads to the White House
